info.title: API Reference
info.description:
# Introduction
 You can manage users,groups,items and permissions in the Bold Reports On-Premise using the REST API.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: When you sign in to the Bold Reports On-Premise, an authentication token is provided that should be attached in the request header(Authorization) for all subsequent API calls to authenticate the requests.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: To retrieve a list of users, or retrieve, create  a particular user in the Bold Reports On-Premise, use the corresponding endpoints below.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description: To retrieve a list of groups, or retrieve, create a particular group in the Bold Reports On-Premise, use the corresponding endpoints below.

tags.name: Items
tags.description: To retrieve a list of items, or retrieve, create, modify, and delete a particular item in the Bold Reports On-Premise, use the corresponding endpoints below.

tags.name: Permission
tags.description: To retrieve a list of permissions, or retrieve, create and delete a particular permission in the Bold Reports On-Premise, use the corresponding endpoints below.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: The type of credentials used to authorize the request for an access token. Valid values: `"password"`

400.description: Email ID is empty

post.summary: Adds a group to the server
post.description: With this endpoint, administrators can add a group to the server by providing the group details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Returns the list of groups on the server
get.description: With this endpoint, users can get the list of group information from the server.

200.description: List of groups was retrieved successfully

delete.summary: Deletes the specified group on the server
delete.description: With this endpoint administrator can delete the specific group on the server by providing group id in the id parameter.

406.description: Invalid group ID

put.summary: Modifies information about a specified group
put.description: With this endpoint, administrators can modify a group to the server by providing the group details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Returns group details on the server for a specified group.
get.description: With this endpoint, administrators can get the group information from the server by providing the Group ID in the path parameter.

get.summary: Returns a list of users on the server for the specified group
get.description: With this endpoint, users can get the list of user information for the specified groups from the server by providing the group ID in the path parameter.

200.description: List of users was retrieved successfully

406.description: Invalid Group ID

417.description: Failed to check the group status

post.summary: Add user(s) to the particular group
post.description: With this endpoint, administrators can add a list of users to a particular group by providing the group ID in the path parameter and the user IDs in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

417.description: Failed to add user to the group

delete.summary: Delete user(s) from the particular group
delete.description: With this endpoint, administrators can delete a list of users from the particular group by providing the group ID in the path parameter and the user IDs in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

417.description: Failed to delete the user from the group

get.summary: Returns item details from the server for a specified item
get.description: Server retrieves the respective item details for the values (CategoryId, DashboardId, DatasourceId, WidgetId, ScheduleId) provided in id parameter for the current user.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified items on the server
delete.description: Users who have a delete access for item (Category, Dashboard, Datasource, Widget, Schedule), can delete the item on the server by providing (CategoryId, DashboardId, DatasourceId, WidgetId, ScheduleId) in id parameter.

400.description: Item ID is empty

post.summary: Add a new category to the server
post.description: Users who have a create access for categories, can add a new category to the server by providing respective category details in the request body.

parameters.name: apiCategoryAdd
parameters.description: Details about the category passed will be added to the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.description: Users who have a write access for categories, can update an existing category on the server by providing respective category details in the request body.

parameters.name: apiCategoryUpdate
parameters.description: Details about the category passed will be updated to the specified category id.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.summary: Checks whether the item name already exists in the server
post.description: Current user can check whether the item (category, report, data source, dataset, schedule) is already exists or not on the server by providing item name (category name, report name, data source name, dataset name, schedule name) and item type (category, report, datasource, dataset, schedule) in the request body.

parameters.name: apiValidateItemName
parameters.description: Details about the item passed will be checked on the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

post.description: Users who have create access for reports can add a new report to the server by providing report details in the request body. In the request body, for DataSourceMappingInfo and DataSetMappingInfo we can pass Datasource Name and Dataset Name from the server and providing either the item content or by passing the RDL report file server path, respectively.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.description: Users who have write access for reports can update an existing report on the server by providing report details in the request body. In the request body, for DataSourceMappingInfo and DataSetMappingInfo, we can pass Datasource Name and Dataset Name from the server, respectively.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.summary: Add a new datasource to the server.
post.description: Users who have a create access for datasources, can add a new datasource to the server by providing respective datasource details in the request body.In the request body, we can also pass Datasource Name from the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.description: Users who have write access for the DataSource can update an existing DataSource on the server by providing respective DataSource details in the request body. In the request body, we can also pass Datasource Name from the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.description: Users who have create access for datasets can add a new dataset to the server by providing the dataset details in the request body. In the request body, for DataSourceMappingInfo, we can also pass the Datasource Name from the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.description: Users who have write access for datasets can update an existing dataset on the server by providing details of the dataset in the request body. In the request body, for DataSourceMappingInfo, we can also pass Datasource Name from the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Returns list of items from the server
get.description: Server retrieves the list of items for the current user.

post.description: Users who have create access for schedule can add new schedule to the server by providing respective details in the request body.

parameters.name: apiScheduleRequest
parameters.description: Details about the schedule passed will be added to the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.description: Users who have write access for schedule can update an existing schedule to the server by providing details of the respective schedule in the request body.

parameters.name: apiUpdateScheduleRequest
parameters.description: Details about the schedule passed will be updated to the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.description: Server retrieves the list of scheduled items for the current user.

200.description: List of scheduled items retrieved succesfully

get.description: Server retrieves the respective scheduled item details for the values (ScheduleId) provided in id parameter for the current user.

200.description: Schedule Item detail was retrieved successfully

get.description: Users who have read access for schedule can run the scheduled report by providing the ID in the path parameter.

400.description: The content of the request body is missed or incomplete

417.description: Failed to run the specified schedule

get.description: Server returns the item location of the specified item for the value Report ID, DataSource ID, DataSet ID provided in the id parameter.

200.description: Item location has been retrieved successfully

400.description: The content of the request body is missed or incomplete

417.description: Failed to get the item location

post.description: Users who have read access for reports can export the reports by providing the report details and export type (Microsoft Excel, PDF, HTML, PPT, CSV and Micorosft Word) in the request body. The response will be in an array of bytes.

parameters.name: apiExportReport
parameters.description: Details about the report to be exported from the server.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.description: Users who have read access for reports can export the reports by providing the report ID and export type (Microsoft Excel, PDF, HTML, PPT, CSV and Micorosft Word) in the request URL and filter parameters in the request body. The response will be in an array of bytes.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Return list of permissions of user
get.description: By this endpoint administrator can retrieves the list of permissions of a specific user by providing user id in the id parameter.

200.description: List of user permissions retrieved succesfully

400.description: User ID is empty

delete.summary: Delete user permission from the server
delete.description: By this endpoint administrator can delete the specific user permissions on the server by providing user permission id in the id parameter.

400.description: Permission id is empty

get.summary: Return list of permissions of group
get.description: By this endpoint administrator can retrieves the list of permissions of a specific group by providing group id in the id parameter.

200.description: List of group permissions retrieved succesfully

406.description: Group id is invalid

delete.summary: Delete group permission from the server
delete.description: By this endpoint administrator can delete the specific group permissions on the server by providing group permission id in the id parameter.

400.description: Permission id is empty

post.summary: Add a user permission to the server
post.description: With this endpoint administrator can add the specific user permissions on the server by providing user permission details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.summary: Add a group permission to the server
post.description: With this endpoint administrator can add the specific group permissions on the server by providing group permission details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

post.summary: Adds a user to the server
post.description: With this endpoint, administrators can add a user to the server by providing the user details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Returns the list of users on the server
get.description: With this endpoint, the user can get the list of users information from the server.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified user on the server
delete.description: With this endpoint administrator can delete the specific user on the server by providing user email address in the user parameter.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

put.summary: Modifies information about the specified user
put.description: With this endpoint, administrators can modify a user to the server by providing the user details in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid

get.summary: Returns user details on the server for a specified user
get.description: With this endpoint, users can get the profile information from the server by providing the Email ID in the path parameter.

post.description: With this endpoint, administrators can activate or de-activate the user account in the server by providing the  email address in the path parameter and activation or de-activation request in the request body.

200.description: The response is sent as ApiResponse object

400.description: The content of the request body is invalid

417.description: Failed to activate or deactivate user account

get.summary: Downloads CSV template from the server.
get.description: With this endpoint, administrators can download the CSV templates from the server.

417.description: Failed to download the CSV template file

post.description: With this endpoint, administrators can add a CSV of users to the server by providing the CSV file as an array of bytes in the request body.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete

get.summary: Get group details of particular user
get.description: With this endpoint, administrators can get the group details of particular users from the server by providing email address, or user ID in the path parameter.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID or Email address of the user.

200.description: Group details can be retrieved successfully

token_type.description: Type of the token assigned by the authorization server

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token

ApiStatus.description: Returns the status of the API.

Status.description: Returns status of the API request.

StatusMessage.description: Returns the status message from the API.

Message.description: Returns the status message from the API.

IsActiveDirectoryGroup.description: Returns true if the group is added from Active Directory

IsAzureADGroup.description: Returns true if the group is added from Azure Active Directory

IsActive.description: Returns true if the user is an active user.

IsActiveDirectoryUser.description: Returns true if the user is added from Active Directory

IsAzureAdUser.description: Returns true if the user is added from Azure Active Directory.

UserStatus.description: Returns the status of the user.

IsActiveDirectoryGroup.description: Returns true if the group is added from Active Directory

IsAzureADGroup.description: Returns true if the group is added from Azure Active Directory

CreatedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item creator.

CloneOf.description: Item ID from where the item was cloned.

ItemCreatedDate.description: Date created of item in date format.

ItemModifiedDate.description: Date modified of item in date format.

CreatedDate.description: Date created of item in string format.

ModifiedDate.description: Date modified of item in string format.

ModifiedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item modifier.

IsPublic.description: Returns true if the item is public.

IsActive.description: Returns true if the item is active.

ItemName.description: Item name. Valid values: `"report name"` `"Datasource name"` `"dataset name"` `"Schedule name"`

ApiStatus.description: Returns the status of the API.

Status.description: Returns status of the API request.

StatusMessage.description: Returns the status message from the API.

PublishedItemId.description: Returns the ID of the published item.

Version.description: Returns the version of the published file item.

ServerPath.description: Specify the relative Path of the item

IsPublic.description: Specify true to set the item as a public

ItemContent.description: Provide items in an array of bytes

CredentialRetrieval.description: Set the type of credentials to secure data

ImpersonateUser.description: Set to true to impersonate  the authenticated user after a connection has been made to the datasource

Password.description: Specifies the password of connection credentials

Prompt.description: Specifies the text that prompts users for a username and password

UserName.description: Specifies the username of connection credentials

WindowsCredentials.description: Set to true to use Windows credentials when connecting to the datasource

CredentialRetrieval.description:
Set the type of credentials to secure data
Prompt: Credentials should be supplied by the user while running the report,
Store: Credentials that stored securely in the report server,
Integrated: Use the Windows credentials of the current user to access the data source,
None: Credentials are not required.

ServerType.description: Select the server type to make datasource connection

ItemContent.description: Provide items in an array of bytes

ServerPath.description: Specify the relative Path of the item

IsPublic.description: Specify true to set item as public

ItemContent.description: Provide items in an array of bytes
Provide items in an array of bytes

CanCopy.description: Specifies the copy permission of the item

CanClone.description: Specifies the clone permission of the item

CanCreateItem.description: Specifies the create permission of the item

CreatedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item creator

CreatedByDisplayName.description: Specifies the display name of the user who created the item

ModifiedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item modifier

ModifiedByFullName.description: Specifies the full name of the user who modified the item

CreatedDate.description: Date created of item in string format

ModifiedDate.description: Date modified of item in string format

ItemModifiedDate.description: Date modified of item in date format

ItemCreatedDate.description: Date created of item in date format

FileContent.description: Declare a File Content property of type array of byte.

ItemName.description: Declare a Item Name property of type string.

Extension.description: Declare a Extension property of type string.

Status.description: Declare a Status property of type bool.

StatusMessage.description: Declare a Status Message property of type string.
Returns the status message from the API.

ApiScheduleRequest.description: Details about the schedule passed will be added to the server.

ExportType.description: Specifies the export type to schedule the report. Valid values: `Excel` `Html` `Pdf` `Word` `PPT` `CSV`.

StartTime.description: Specifies the UTC start date-time of schedule. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

NeverEnd.description: Sets the schedule with no end when specified as true. \n\n Note: By default, the NeverEnd is set to true. To set the end time for schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise it remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description: Specifies the number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed. \n\n For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndDate.description: Specifies the UTC end date-time of schedule after which schedule will be completed. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`. \n\n For example: If you provide the end date-time, the schedule will end when the end date-time is reached.

UserList.description: Provides the list of email addresses or user IDs to the recipients who will get the schedules.

GroupList.description: Provides the list of group IDs to the recipients in the group list who will get the schedules.

ExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides the list of email addresses to the email recipients who will get the schedules.

ScheduleType.description: Specifies the schedule type to schedule the report. Valid values: `Hourly` `Daily` `Weekly` `Monthly` `Yearly`. \n\n Note: If you chose the schedule type as `Monthly`, provide a values to the MonthlySchedule property, and leave the (HourlySchedule, DailySchedule, WeeklySchedule and YearlySchedule) properties empty.

HourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

DailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

WeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

MonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

YearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

ApiHourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

ScheduleInterval.description: Specifies the hour interval. Based on this interval the schedule will run continuously until the end time. The format should be `HH:mm`.

ApiDailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

RecurrenceType.description: Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs every day or every working day.  Valid values: `EveryNdays` `EveryWeekday`. \n\n Note: If you chose the recurrence type as EveryNdays, provide a value to the EveryNdays property, and leave the (EveryWeekday) property empty.

EveryNdays.description: Specifies the day interval the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 2, the schedule recurs every 2 days.

EveryWeekday.description: For the schedule to recur every working day, set to true.

ApiWeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

RecurrenceWeeks.description: Specifies the number of weeks the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 2, the schedule will recur every 2 weeks.

RecurrenceDays.description: Specifies the list of  days the schedule recurs. Valid values `Sunday` `Monday` `Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. \n\n For example: If you provide `Sunday`, the schedule will recur sunday's of every 2 weeks.

ApiMonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

RecurrenceType.description: Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a specific day or on the customized day basis. Valid values: `DayRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence` \n\n Note: If you chose the recurrence type as DayRecurrence, provide a value to the DayRecurrence property and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

DayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

ApiMonthlyScheduleDayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

DayInterval.description: Specifies the number of day interval the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 10, the schedule will recur every 10th day.

MonthInterval.description: Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 3, the schedule will recur 10th day of every 3 months.

ApiMonthlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

WeekOfMonth.description: Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs. Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. \n\n For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description: Specifies the day of the week the schedule recurs. Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday` `Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. \n\n For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on the second week of sunday.

MonthInterval.description: Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur second week of sunday's of every 5 months.

ApiYearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

YearInterval.description: Specifies the number of years the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur every 5 years.

RecurrenceType.description: Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a month basis or on the customized month basis. Valid values: `MonthRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence`. \n\n Note: If you chose the recurrence type as MonthRecurrence, provide a value to the MonthRecurrence property, and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

MonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in YearInterval property.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the YearInterval property.

ApiYearlyScheduleMonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in YearInterval property.

MonthOfYear.description: Specifies the month the schedule recurs. Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June` `July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. \n\n For example: If you provide April, the schedule will recur in April of every year. Here the (year) is the value provided in the YearInterval property.

DayOfMonth.description: Specifies the day of the month the schedule recurs. \n\n For example: If you provide 20, the schedule will recur 20th April of every year.  Here the (year) is the value provided in the YearInterval property.

ApiYearlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the YearInterval property.

WeekOfMonth.description: Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs. Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. \n\n For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description: Specifies the day of week the schedule recurs. Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday` `Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`.\n\n For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on every sunday's of the second week.

MonthOfYear.description: Specifies the month the schedule recurs.  Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June` `July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. \n\n For example: If you provide March, the schedule will recur on the sunday's of the second week of March every year. Here the (year) is the value provided in the YearInterval property.

Values.description: Parameter values. The Date parameters input values are validated based on the server culture. Valid formats for en-us culture as following: `mm/dd/yyyy` `yyyy/mm/dd` `dd/mmm/yyyy` `mmm/dd/yyyy` `yyyy/dd/mmm` `yyyy/mmm/dd`.

ApiUpdateScheduleRequest.description: Details about the schedule passed will be updated to the server.

ExportType.description: Specifies the export type to schedule the report. Valid values: `Excel` `Html` `Pdf` `Word` `PPT` `CSV`.

StartTime.description: Specifies the UTC start date-time of schedule. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

NeverEnd.description: Sets the schedule with no end when specified as true. \n\n Note: By default, the NeverEnd is set to true. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description: Specifies the number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed. \n\n For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndDate.description: Specifies the UTC end date-time of schedule after which schedule will be completed. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`. \n\n For example: If you provide the end date-time, the schedule will end once the end date-time is reached.

UserList.description: Provides the list of email addresses or user IDs to the recipients who will get the schedules.

GroupList.description: Provides the list of group IDs to the recipients in the group list who will get the schedules.

ExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides the list of email addresses to the email recipients who will get the schedules.

RemoveUserList.description: Provides the list of email addresses or user IDs to remove recipients from the schedule subscriptions.

RemoveGroupList.description: Provides the list of group IDs to remove groups from the schedule subscriptions.

RemoveExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides the list of email addresses to remove email recipients from the schedule subscriptions.

ScheduleType.description: Specifies the schedule type to schedule the report. Valid values: `Hourly` `Daily` `Weekly` `Monthly` `Yearly`. \n\n Note: If you chose the schedule type as `Monthly`, provide a values to the MonthlySchedule property, and leave the (HourlySchedule, DailySchedule, WeeklySchedule and YearlySchedule) property empty.

HourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

DailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

WeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

MonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

YearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

CreatedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item creator.

CreatedDate.description: Date created of item in date format.

EndDate.description: Specifies the the end date of the schedule.

ExportTypeId.description: Specifies the export type id of schedule.

IsActive.description: Returns true, if the Schedule is active.

IsEnabled.description: Returns true, if the Schedule is enabled.

ModifiedDate.description: Date modified of item in date format.

ModifiedById.description: Specifies the user ID of the item modifier.

NextSchedule.description: Specifies the Next scheduled date and time.

RecurrenceInfo.description: Specifies the recurrence information of the schedule.

RecurrenceTypeId.description: Specifies the recurrence Id of the schedule.

RecurrenceType.description: Specifies the recurrence type of the schedule.

StartDate.description: Specifies the start date of the schedule.

NeverEnd.description: Sets the schedule with no end when specified as true. \n\n Note: By default, the NeverEnd is set to true. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description: Specifies the number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed. \n\n For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

UserList.description: Provides the list of username, email, or user IDs to the recipients who will get the schedules.

GroupList.description: Provides the list of group IDs to the recipients in the group list who will get the schedules.

ExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides the list of email IDs to the email recipients who will get the schedules.

HourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

DailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

WeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

MonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

YearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

PermissionAccess.description: Specify an access type for item.

ItemId.description: Specify the item ID while assigning permission to particular item.

PermissionAccess.description: Specify an access type for item.

PermissionEntity.description: Specify an entity of item for permission.

ItemId.description: Specify the item ID while assigning permission to particular item.

ApiDownloadCsvTemplate.description: Contains response of downloaded CSV template file.

Status.description: Returns status of the API request.

StatusMessage.description: Returns the status message from the API.

FileContent.description: Returns CSV file in array of bytes.

ApiCsvUserImportResponse.description: Contains response of Csv user import

ApiStatus.description: Returns the status of the API.

Status.description: Returns status of the API request.

CsvFileContent.description: Provides the CSV file in an array of bytes.

ApiExportReport.description: Details about the report to be exported

ServerPath.description: Specifies the relative URL of the report.
